triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The core technique that the paper reviews for enabling robots to learn complex skills from low-level sensor observations.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The foundational machine learning paradigm that deep RL extends and which is central to the paper's focus.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: The application domain in which the paper studies how deep RL can enable robots to learn autonomous behaviors.

triples.name: Video game
triples.relevance: A key simulated domain mentioned where much deep RL research has focused, contrasted with real-world robotics applications.

triples.name: Sensor
triples.relevance: Sensors provide the low-level observations from which robots must learn to perceive their environment.

triples.name: Embodied cognition
triples.relevance: The paper discusses learning as an embodied agent in the real world, connecting to how humans learn through physical interaction.
